- **No configuration necessary**. Just install Zoe and you're ready to go.
- **[Prettier](https://github.com/prettier/prettier)** for formatting and style rules.
- Out-of-the-box support for **React** and **Jest**.
- Fix issues by running `zoe --fix`.
- Includes [eslint-plugin-jest](https://github.com/jest-community/eslint-plugin-jest), [eslint-plugin-unicorn](https://github.com/sindresorhus/eslint-plugin-unicorn) and [more](https://github.com/jorgegonzalez/eslint-config-zoe/blob/master/index.js#L201).

## Installation

Install locally:

```sh
npm i -D zoe
```

or globally:

```sh
npm i -g zoe
```

## Create an ESLint Config

The Zoe CLI will support React and ES6 syntax with no configuration. For additional ESLint tooling support, create a `.eslintrc` file and extend the configs that you need:

### Extend from Zoe to enable all core rules, plugins, and React support

```json
{
  "extends": "zoe"
}
```

### Overrides

Zoe uses Prettier's defaults for style and cosmetic rules, and will respect Prettier's various [configuration](https://prettier.io/docs/en/configuration.html) options and files.

Most rules can be overrided normally by adding them to your `.eslintrc#rules`:

```json
{
  "extends": "zoe",
  "rules": {
    "no-console": "error"
  }
}
```

## Tips

### Add Zoe to `package.json#scripts`

```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "lint": "zoe",
    "lint:fix": "zoe --fix"
  }
}
```

### Create a `.prettierrc` file to keep Zoe in sync with your Prettier config

Zoe will respect all custom Prettier settings

```json
{
  "singleQuote": true
}
```

### Create a `.eslintignore` file to make Zoe skip certain paths

```git
**/node_modules/**
lib
build
```
